task_summary: Drive down the corridor and reach the named goal location, then verify arrival.

task_long_description.overview: The scene shows a mobile robot in a straight indoor corridor. Frames progress from a wider hallway view to a close-up wall/door area, suggesting forward motion toward a terminal goal. The robot must navigate directly toward the named location "goal" and then confirm arrival. No obstacles are apparent; lighting is consistent. We constrain execution with a bounded timeout and allow limited retries to handle transient localization or planning failures.
preconditions: Robot has a valid map or localization sufficient for NavigateToNamed(goal).
Corridor is traversable and free of dynamic obstacles.
Goal location_id "goal" is configured in the navigation stack.
stepwise_plan: Attempt to navigate to location_id=goal with a bounded timeout.
Retry up to three times if the navigation attempt fails.
After a successful navigation action, verify position using IsAt(target=goal).
success_criteria: NavigateToNamed reports success within the timeout.
IsAt(target=goal) returns true immediately after navigation.
failure_and_recovery: If NavigateToNamed fails or times out, RetryUntilSuccessful triggers a new attempt.
If verification fails, the sequence aborts and external higher-level recovery can reissue the task.
task_long_description.termination: Tree returns SUCCESS when IsAt(target=goal) is true after navigation; otherwise FAILURE if all retries/timeouts are exhausted.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Command the base to navigate to a named map location.
Check if the robot is at the named target location.
Limit execution time of the child.
Repeat the child until success or attempts are exhausted.
Run children in order; stop on first failure.

failure_modes: Path planning timeout due to blocked corridor
Verification mismatch where IsAt fails after motion
recovery_strategy: Automatic retry of navigation up to three times
After tree failure, re-localize or choose alternative route externally
assumptions: The "goal" corresponds to the far end of the corridor/doorway visible in later frames.
No significant dynamic obstacles are present.
Frames indicate straight-line approach consistent with a single NavigateToNamed action.

expected_success_criteria: NavigateToNamed returns success within 5000 ms and IsAt(goal) is true.
